title.narrative: Strengthening Anti-Trafficking in Persons (TIP) in Algeria

description.narrative: This project will work to strengthen capacities for improved coordination, identification, protection, and prosecution of trafficking in persons in Algeria, with particular attention on providing assistance to individuals impacted by the African migration crisis. The implementing organization aims to achieve this goal by improving the capacity of law enforcement, the judiciary, health care officials, and social workers to identify, investigate, and adjudicate trafficking crimes. International Organization for Migration (IOM) will develop a multidisciplinary training session, and follow-up trainings on core elements of a victim-centered identification, investigation, and prosecution model. A goal of the project is for the government to increase the number and quality of trafficking investigations and prosecutions of offenders. IOM will also work to improve identification, referral, and protection services for actual and potential victims of trafficking. IOM will work in cooperation with the governments inter-ministerial committee on trafficking, civil society organizations, and international organizations to develop standard operating procedures to screen and refer migrants to protection, legal, medical, social, and return and reintegration services. IOM will also map existing and potential shelter service providers for victims of trafficking, refurbish shelters, and train shelter staff to screen and assist victims of trafficking. IOM will increase the understanding of trafficking and the risks of irregular migration through a national awareness campaign, including radio broadcasts. Finally, IOM will provide technical assistance to local civil society organizations that work with vulnerable populations, including migrants, women, and unaccompanied children.

title.narrative: Documentation of the Ancient Coin Collection at the Cirta Museum in Constantine

description.narrative: To support the documentation of the ancient coin collection at the Cirta Museum in Constantine. The collection of 19,000 coins spanning 20 centuries has yet to be catalogued, and museum staff lack training in cleaning and caring for coins. The project focuses on the conservation of the collection under the direction of a conservation expert and conservation training for the museum staff.
